alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT CAMDEN...PASQUOTANK... CENTRAL PERQUIMANS...NORTHEASTERN GATES...AND CURRITUCK COUNTIES... THE SOUTHERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 744 PM EDT, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Northwest to near Elizabeth City to near Valhalla. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail are possible with these storms. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Elizabeth City State University, Grandy, Weeksville, South Mills, Chesapeake, Sanderling, Chapanoke, Fentress, Nixonton, Point Harbor, Shiloh, Back Bay, Indiantown, Morgans Corner, Corolla and Old Trap. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
